etymologies: late Middle English (earliest attested as a term in Scots law): from Old French reconniss-, stem of reconnaistre, from Latin recognoscere ‘know again, recall to mind’, from re- ‘again’ + cognoscere ‘learn’

definitions: identify (someone or something) from having encountered them before; know again

examples.text: I recognized her when her wig fell off
Julia hardly recognized Jill when they met

shortDefinitions: identify person or thing from having encountered them before

definitions: identify from knowledge of appearance or character

examples.text: Pat is very good at recognizing wildflowers

shortDefinitions: identify from knowledge of appearance or character

definitions: (of a computer or other machine) automatically identify and respond correctly to (a sound, printed character, etc.)

examples.text: Dr. Friedman is programming his computer to recognize the shapes of strokes in the hands of various writers

shortDefinitions: (of computer or other machine) automatically identify and respond correctly to

definitions: acknowledge the existence, validity, or legality of

examples.text: the defense is recognized in Mexican law
he was recognized as an international authority
it is important to recognize that a variety of indirect forms of discrimination operate

shortDefinitions: acknowledge existence, validity, or legality of

definitions: show official appreciation of; reward formally

examples.text: his work was recognized by an honorary degree from Georgetown University

definitions: officially regard (a qualification) as valid or proper

examples.text: these qualifications are recognized by the Department of Education
courses that lead to recognized qualifications

shortDefinitions: officially regard qualification as valid or proper

definitions: grant diplomatic recognition to (a country or government)

examples.text: they were refusing to recognize the puppet regime

definitions: (of a person presiding at a meeting or debate) call on (someone) to speak.

synonyms.text: put the seal of approval on
